derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English crabba, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch krabbe, and more distantly to Dutch kreeft and German Krebs; also crab
late 16th cent. (referring to hawks, meaning 'claw or fight each other'): from Low German krabben; related to crab

entry.def: A crab is a sea creature with a flat round body covered by a shell, and five pairs of legs with large claws on the front pair. Crabs usually move sideways.

means.word_mean: 1. decapod having eyes on short stalks and a broad flattened carapace with a small abdomen folded under the thorax and pincers
3. the edible flesh of any of various crabs
4. infests the pubic region of the human body
5. a stroke of the oar that either misses the water or digs too deeply;
